comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Could be same as www.npg.org.uk/collections/search/portrait.php?LinkID=mp5... -- which is presumably the same actress as in IMDB despite different date of birth. www.ibdb.com/person.php?id=47998 lists Broadway plays she was in, a the time period certainly matches. I'm assuming this picture is of her in a particular role.

comment.author: 34427466731@N01
comment._content: the ibdb link there links to a actor listed as Male.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: striatic, I'm suspicious that IBDB is wrong. According to www.answers.com/topic/the-unchastened-woman, Willette Kershaw played a character called Emily in 'The Unchastened Woman" -- on the list. And the NYT on August 31, 1910 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9900E0D91239E433A... lists her as playing Amy Leroy in "The Country Boy" -- also on the list. And surely it would be odd (at least in 1910-15) to have someone with a name ending in "ette" be a man.

comment.author: 34427466731@N01
comment._content: so how do we go about getting IBDB to correct their record?

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I found pictures of Willette Kershaw in Chronicling America. -- www.loc.gov/chroniclingamerica/ There are more but these two appealed to me most: www.loc.gov/chroniclingamerica/lccn/sn84026749/1910-04-08... www.loc.gov/chroniclingamerica/lccn/sn85066387/1908-10-19...

comment.author: 53993116@N05
comment._content: Broadway actress Willette Kershaw(1882-1960), this still is from a short play called ANY NIGHT.  In Daniel Blum's "Pictorial History of the American Theatre" she is seen in this costume and on this set being carried through the window by a fireman.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The photo (or one very like it) was used in the NYT of April 20, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F70E1FF93A5D13738...
